questions.question_text: An organization's database administrator (DBA) has implemented native database auditing. Which of the following is the GREATEST concern with this situation?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The greatest concern with implementing native database auditing is that production database performance may be negatively affected. Enabling auditing features at the database level, especially with extensive auditing or for a large number of database activities, can lead to increased system overhead, which may impact the performance of the production database.
C. Production database performance may be negatively affected.

questions.question_text: When protecting the confidentiality of information assets, the MOST effective control practice is the:

choices.B: enforcement of a need-to-know access control philosophy.
choices.C: utilization of a dual-factor authentication mechanism.
choices.A: awareness training of personnel on regulatory requirements.
choices.D: configuration of read-only access to all users.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The most effective control practice for protecting the confidentiality of information assets is the enforcement of a need-to-know access control philosophy. This principle ensures that individuals have access only to the information necessary to perform their job functions, reducing the risk of unauthorized access and disclosure of sensitive information.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the MOST important consideration when relying on the work of the prior auditor?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
When an auditor proposes a recommendation, it is important how it is agreed between the organization's management and stakeholders. If the management agreement is documented, it will be the basis for checking whether the recommendation was implemented and, if implemented, what its effect was. It will also be an important source of information when prioritizing recommendations and understanding the progress of their implementation.

The qualifications of B's previous auditor also have a certain meaning, but the auditor's qualifications and experience are only indicators for judging the appropriateness and feasibility of the recommendations. In order to actually check whether the recommendations were appropriate and effective for the organization, the content of the management agreement with the recommendations is important.

Selected Answer: B
Assessing the qualifications ensures that the prior auditor had the necessary expertise and ethical standards to conduct a thorough and reliable audit.

choices.D: Number of findings identified by the prior auditor

questions.question_text: A bank uses a system that requires monetary amounts found on check images to be input twice by two separate individuals. The system then identifies any mismatches between the first and second input. Which type of control has the bank implemented?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
In IaaS, the operating system is part of the infrastructure and hence under the control of the cloud provider.

Selected Answer: A
Detective Control: This is a type of control designed to identify and report errors or irregularities after they have occurred. Key verification falls into this category because it detects data entry errors after the initial entry by comparing it against a second entry.
Compensating Control: A compensating control is an alternative control put in place to mitigate the risk when the primary control is deemed inadequate or is not feasible. It's essentially a backup measure, used when the preferred method of controlling a risk is too costly or complex. Compensating controls are generally used to achieve the same control objective as the primary control.

Selected Answer: A
Key verification is a form of detective control. It is designed to detect errors or discrepancies in data entry after the initial entry has occurred. By having data entered twice, usually by two different individuals, and then comparing the two sets of data, discrepancies can be identified and corrected. This process happens after the initial data entry error occurs, hence it is a detective control, not a preventive one.

Selected Answer: A
The bank has implemented a Detective control. A Detective control is designed to discover or detect errors or discrepancies after they have occurred. In this case, the system identifies mismatches between the first and second input of monetary amounts on check images, serving as a detective control to catch discrepancies.
Corrective controls are implemented to correct or remedy an issue after it has been identified, while Compensating controls offset the lack of effectiveness in other controls. Deterrent controls are implemented to discourage individuals from violating policies or procedures, often through the threat of penalties.
On A, Compensating control always apply after transaction

questions.question_text: An organization is migrating its HR application to an Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) model in a private cloud. Who is PRIMARILY responsible for the security configurations of the deployed application's operating system?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D: The organization

Selected Answer: D
In an IaaS model in a private cloud, the organization is primarily responsible for the security configurations of the deployed application's operating system. While the cloud provider manages the underlying infrastructure, including the virtualization layer and physical hardware, the organization retains responsibility for configuring and securing the components deployed on top of that infrastructure.
The organization needs to configure and manage the operating system, applications, and associated security settings within the virtual machines provided by the cloud infrastructure. This shared responsibility model is a key characteristic of cloud computing, where the organization and the cloud provider have distinct responsibilities for different layers of the infrastructure and services.

Selected Answer: D
D. The organization

In an Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) model, the organization is primarily responsible for the security configurations of the deployed application's operating system. While the cloud provider is responsible for the security of the underlying infrastructure (such as the physical servers, networking, and data center facilities) and may provide certain security features and tools, the organization retains responsibility for securing the operating system and the applications they deploy on top of the cloud infrastructure.

comments.content: This concept is often referred to as the "shared responsibility model," where the division of security responsibilities is typically outlined in the cloud service provider's terms of service or service-level agreements. The organization is responsible for configuring and maintaining the security of their virtual machines, including the operating system and application-level security settings.
